column1: Ramanayyapeta is a census town in East Godavari district of the Indian state of Andhra Pradesh. It is located in Kakinada (rural) mandal of Kakinada revenue division. The town is a constituent of Kakinada urban agglomeration.

column3: 323. Males constitute 51% of the population and females 49%. Ramanayyapeta has an average literacy rate of 75%
column4: higher than the national average of 59.5%: male literacy is 79%
column5: and female literacy is 71%. In Ramanayyapeta
column6: 11% of the population is under 6 years of age.

column1: The primary and secondary school education is imparted by government
column3: under the School Education Department of the state. The medium of instruction followed by different schools are English
